columns.text: In this problem, we will determine which projects should be accepted or rejected by the company based on their expected rate of return.

The company's expected rate of return allows us to estimate how much of the initial investment will come back as profit. The expected rate of return of the projects in this problem can be solved using the Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM). 

The Capital Asset Pricing Model shows the relationship between the risk and the expected return of the assets. This can be solved using this formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Expected return}&=\text{Risk-free rate} +\text{Beta} \times (\text{Required return}-\text{Risk-free return})
\end{aligned}$$

**a.)** Using CAPM, we will solve for the expected return of the projects. 

Project W:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Expected return}&=0.04 +0.85\times (0.11-0.04)\\[15 pt]
&=0.0995\\
&=9.95\%
\end{aligned}$$

Project X:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Expected return}&=0.04 +0.92\times (0.11-0.04)\\[15 pt]
&=0.1044\\
&=10.44\%
\end{aligned}$$

Project Y:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Expected return}&=0.04 +1.09\times (0.11-0.04)\\[15 pt]
&=0.1163\\
&=11.63\%
\end{aligned}$$

Project Z:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Expected return}&=0.04 +1.35\times (0.11-0.04)\\[15 pt]
&=0.1345\\
&=13.45\%
\end{aligned}$$

As we can see from these, **Projects Y and Z** have a higher return than the company's $11\%$ expected rate of return.

**b.)** Now we will compare the values for the expected return that we solved in the item above to the internal rate of return of the project. In order for a project to be accepted, the expected rate of return must be higher than their internal rate of return.


From what we can see, only **Projects W and Z** have higher expected rate of return than the internal rate of return, therefore only these projects should be accepted.

**c.)** If we use the company's overall cost of capital as the hurdle rate, this means that the expected rate of return that we solved in **a.)** will be the base. This means only the project whose internal rate of return of $11\%$ is higher will be accepted. 

If this is the case, then only **Projects W and X** will be accepted since the internal rate of return of $11\%$ is higher than their expected rate of return of $9.95\%$ and $10.44\%$, respectively.
